title: Angry Birds Stella
description: There are so many different Angry Birds crochet patterns already available. Problem is that the majority of them use felt and other accessories to make the details. I couldn't find one with 100% crochet, so I made one.
cardDescription: Having crocheted all the other Angry Birds characters, I got a request to do Stella. Since that pattern didn't exist, I created one.

content.content: Finished size of Stella is about 10cm x 10cm.
Materials

content: Pink, white, yellow, black and cyan worsted weight yarns

content.content: Stella Body
Body is done working in a spiral from top to bottom. There is no need to join rounds but rather just continue around.
Use pink yarn. Start stuffing when you reach round 23.
Fasten off and leave a tail for sewing. Finish stuffing the body with fiber fill and sew the remaining hole shut.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-1.jpg
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-2.jpg
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-3.jpg
Stomach patch
Stomach patch is done working in a spiral. Use white yarn.
Fasten off and leave a long tail for sewing.
TIP: To help align all the details symmetrically in place, wrap a piece of yarn around the body.
Position the stomach patch under the body, slightly offset towards the front, and sew it tightly.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-5.jpg
Beak
The beak is crocheted in a spiral without joining between rounds. Use yellow yarn.
Fasten off and leave a long tail for sewing.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-6.jpg
Feathers
Feathers are worked in a spiral. Also to add little detail, vary the height of each feather by a row or two. Make three feathers. Use pink yarn.
Fasten off and leave a tail for sewing.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-7.jpg
Tail
Tail consists of three sets of chains with stitches. Avoid tight stitches so the tail won't curve too much. Use black yarn

content: 6 ch, sc to 2nd chain and across [5]
6 ch, sc to 2nd chain and across [5]
6 ch, sc to 2nd chain and across [5]

content.content: Fasten off and leave a tail for sewing.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-8.jpg
Eyes
Eyes are done working in a spiral. Don't join between rounds. Make two eyes. Use white yarn.
Fasten off and leave a tail for sewing.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-9.jpg
Use cyan yarn for the irises.

content: 4 sc into magic ring, sl st [4]

content.content: Fasten off and leave a tail for sewing.
Sew the irises in the middle of the eyes. Use the beginning yarn of the eye to make a small pupil in the middle of the iris.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-10.jpg
Use black yarn for the eyelashes.
Select three adjacent eye stitches. The eyelashes are attached to the front loops of those stitches. This makes them come out from under the eye and hide the attachment of the black yarn.
Attach the black yarn to the front loop of the first selected stitch. Chain 2 and fasten off. Make the next two eyelashes similarly to the adjacent stitches with chain 3 and chain 4, respectively.
Mirror the eyelashes for the other eye.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-11.jpg
Finishing Stella
Sew the beak (stuff with fiber fill before closing), feathers, tail and the eyes in place using the yarn wrapped around the body as a guidance.
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-13.jpg
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-pattern-14.jpg
/crochet-pattern-images/angry-birds-stella/stella-4.jpg
